page.title: 06Cotton End Village Hall
page.content: The village Hall was built in approximately 1974 and has a seating capacity for 120 persons. The Hall is run by a committee and used by members of the community for a limited variety of activities. On Monday evening it is used for bingo. On Tuesday evening there is a whist drive while on Friday evenings the youth club get together. Cotton End senior citizens meet every Wednesday afternoon for a happy hour. The Hall may also be hired for use by private parties for wedding receptions, birthdays etc. Many people would like to see a wider range of activities taking place in the Hall but too often any new venture fails through lack of general support. A monthly village lottery, the 200 Club, is run by the village hall committee.
